WorkItem.Description:
Any time I use the "edit" menu to switch a gem, I get an error the next time I click on an object on my character sheet. I've tested it both loading my own profile as well as just tossing random gear into a few slots and trying it out. I right click and edit one piece of gear, switch the gem, click OK. Then as soon as I left click on another item, I get the following error:

Comments.Message: I have this same issue, but only in Windows XP.
Uninstall whatever version of .NET Framework you have installed, and then install the latest version (3.5 SP1, at time of writing). You can download it from microsoft.com.

I found this possilby related bug and a workaround here: http://codebetter.com/blogs/patricksmacchia/archive/2007/09/12/dissecting-an-undeterministic-windows-forms-v2-bug.aspx

I understand we're manually configuring tooltips and it's possible that we're creating the same problem with changing the parent of a tooltip, so that should be investigated.

It is also mentioned there that a workaround as Astrylian noted is to install .Net version 3.5 SP1 which indeed includes a fix for this problem.
Is it possible for Rawr to detect what version of net is being used and give a warning to update it?  This error drove me nuts until i stumbled across this post.
